name: bistorta-amplexicaulis-firetail
country-or-region-of-origin: Easterm Afghanistan and Central China, West Himalayas, Pakistan
edibility: The rhizome is blackish-brown or purplish on the outside and reddish-brown on the inside. It contains about 20% tannin, and also contains gallic acids, gum, and is high in starch. In Pakistan, leaves are used as a vegetable. In Northern England, the leaves of the plant are used in combination with oatmeal, eggs, and herbs to make a bitter pudding during Lent.  The roots contain large amounts of starch and are roasted and are eaten similar to potatoes in Russia and northern Asia. Bread can be made from flour made from the roots.
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: The fruit is three-seeded, and shiny.  Birds feed on the seed.
flower-description: The fluffy rose-red to white, dense, bottlebrush shaped flower spikes are approximately .2 of an inch wide and Â½ to 4 inches long.  Blooms last all summer, sometimes until the first frost.  Spikes may be solitary or branched.
leaf-description: The bluish-green leathery leaves are slightly puckered, and tapered to a sharp point, cordate shaped at the base, with an ash-grey downy underside. The leaves have a prominent midrib, and have a jointed appearance at each leaf node, as each leaf clasps the stems with the leaf stipules sheathing the stem.
stem-description: Fleshy stems are 13 to 27 inches long, simple or branched, erect, and having few leaves.
uses: The entire plant of Mountain Fleece has been used to make medicinal products. It has been used to treat diarrhea, cough, nose bleeds, wound healing, ulcers, gout, backache, hemorrhoids, and other conditions, but there is no good scientific evidence to support these uses.  The root of Mountain Fleece is one of the strongest vegetable astringents among native vegetables. The plant is also used to make tea, for the treatment of flu, fever, and joint problems. The root has been used for tanning leather.
